verses.roman:
nīlācala āsite pathe bhāṅgilā mora daṇḍa
tomā-sabāra gāḍha-snehe āmāra kārya-bhaṅga

synonyms: nīlācala—to Jagannātha Purī; āsite—going there; pathe—on the road; bhāṅgilā—You broke; mora—My; daṇḍa—sannyāsa staff; tomā-sabāra—of all of you; gāḍha-snehe—on account of the deep affection; āmāra—My; kārya-bhaṅga—disturbance of activities.
translation: "While on the way to Jagannātha Purī, You broke My sannyāsa staff. I know that all of you have great affection for Me, but such things disturb My activities.
